title: The Block's Mel slams boyfriend Jesse as the villain continues his feud with rivals Mitch and Mark
text:
He got into a heated argument with stylish grandads Mitch Edwards and Mark McKie on Tuesday's episode of The Block.

And on Wednesday's show, Jesse Raeburn was complaining about their feud when his girlfriend Mel Manson overheard him and flew into a rage.

Mel said she was 'furious' with Jesse for carrying on with the drama when they have so much work to do, saying: 'Talk about something once and then f**king move on!'

'Talk about it then f**king move on!' The Block's Mel unleashed on her boyfriend Jesse on the show on Wednesday as he continued the feud with Mitch and Mark

Jesse was explaining his issues with Mitch and Mark to fellow contestant Tess Struber when Mel overheard and started yelling at him.

'Stop carrying on, I'm sick of... talk about something once and then f**king move on!' she told him.

She later told producers: 'Just get some work done. I'm so done with drama this week... it's petty things now, I'm sick of people, you're all adults!'

In the hot seat! Mel said she was 'furious' with Jesse (pictured) for carrying on with the drama when they have so much work to do

It comes after Jesse's spat with Mitch and Mark on Tuesday's episode, which began when the real estate agent denied owing the older couple two hours of painting.

Mark was visibly angry, saying: 'At the moment, I don't give a f**k anymore, I don't want anything to do with him!'

He added to producers: 'He doesn't listen, he doesn't listen to Scott who has 30 years building experience.

Spat: It comes after Jesse's spat with Mitch (L) and Mark (R) on Tuesday's episode, which began when the real estate agent denied owing the older couple two hours of painting

'He bombards people, and doesn't listen, it's quite a bullying tactic. And that's why I don't want to discuss it with Jesse. He seems to go on the attack and we're not interested in that.'

At one point, Jesse tried to confront Mark in front of the cameras, and Mark accused him of trying to 'make himself look better' on television.

Earlier in the week, Jesse argued with Scott Cam over a $600 carpentry bill, with the host eventually storming off the building site.
description: He got into a heated argument with stylish grandads Mitch Edwards and Mark McKie on Tuesday's episode of The Block.
authors: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
